sections.title: Introduction (Wide Shot)
sections.content: Welcome back to our web development series! I'm Sayed Jihad Al Sayed, and in this video, we'll explore text elements and formatting in HTML. These are crucial for structuring and styling the content of your web pages.

sections.title: Headings (Close Shot + Screen Recording)
sections.content: HTML provides six levels of headings, from `<h1>` to `<h6>`. The `<h1>` tag defines the most important heading, while `<h6>` defines the least important.
sections.code:
This is a heading 1

This is a heading 2

This is a heading 3

This is a heading 4

This is a heading 5
This is a heading 6

sections.title: Paragraphs (Close Shot + Screen Recording)
sections.content:
Paragraphs are defined with the `

` tag. They are used to group blocks of text together.
sections.code:
This is a paragraph of text.

Here is another paragraph of text.

sections.title: Text Formatting (Close Shot + Screen Recording)
sections.content: HTML includes several elements for formatting text. Here are some commonly used ones:
sections.code:
This text is bold

This text is strong

This text is italic

This text is emphasized

This text is marked

This text is small

This text is deleted

This text is inserted

This text is subscript

This text is superscript

sections.title: Line Breaks and Horizontal Rules (Close Shot + Screen Recording)
sections.content:
To create a line break, use the `
` tag. For a horizontal rule, use the `
` tag.
sections.code:
This is a line of text.
This is another line of text.

This is a paragraph after a horizontal rule.

sections.title: Combining Text Elements (Close Shot + Screen Recording)
sections.content: You can combine these elements to create more complex text structures. Here’s an example:
sections.code:
Main Heading

This is a paragraph with some bold and italic text. Here is a link.

Here is another paragraph with highlighted text and some small text.

sections.title: Practical Example (Close Shot + Screen Recording)
sections.content: Let's put it all together in a simple example that uses headings, paragraphs, and various text formatting elements:
sections.code:
Welcome to My Web Page

This is a paragraph of text. This text is bold and this text is italic.

Here is a paragraph with a link and some highlighted text.

Another Section

Text can be small, deleted, or inserted.

Use subscript and superscript for different effects.

sections.title: Recap and Next Steps (Wide Shot)
sections.content: That's a quick overview of text elements and formatting in HTML! In the next video, we'll dive into adding links and images to your web pages.

sections.title: Engagement Call-to-Action (Close Shot)
sections.content: If you found this video helpful, please like, subscribe, and leave a comment below with any questions or feedback. Don’t forget to hit the notification bell to stay updated with our latest tutorials.

sections.title: Outro (Wide Shot)
sections.content: Thanks for watching, and I'll see you in the next video!
